sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"连续，顺序"之意。
means: sequence ： 多指时间、空间或事件等有规律、合乎逻辑的连续。
progression ： 指向前推进的行为过程或状态的连续。
series ： 指按照性质类似或基本相同的关系而安排的一系列事物。
succession ： 侧重一些类似的东西或事件一个接一个连续不断。

word_mean: 某一地段上群落由一种类型自然演变为另一类型的有顺序的更替过程。

sentence.Network_en: The road is a succession of hairpin bends, hills, and blind corners.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条路上急转弯、坡道和死拐角一个接一个。

sentence.Network_en: Scoring three goals in quick succession, he made it 10-8.
sentence.Network_cn: 在短短的时间内他连进三球，最终以10比8取胜。

sentence.Network_en: Yesterday's emphatic victory was their fifth in succession.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天的大胜是他们连续第5场胜利。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新编大学英语单词表(第二册) - 豆丁网 ... skeptic n. 怀疑者 succession n. 连续 swan n. 天鹅.
财务分析词汇中的英文对照，谢谢_百度知道 ... successful tenderer 中标者 succession 继承 successor 继承人.
...，随着时间的推移，一个群落被另一个群落代替的过程叫演替（succession），当然演替并不是完全取而代之，比如森林阶段也照样 …
双面女间谍_百度百科 ... 第九集：通道：下（ "Passage Part 2） 第二集：继任（succession）（ Succession） 第三集：重聚（ Reunion）.

list.abs: 人教版七年级上册英语单词表 ... new adj. 新的 successful adj. 成功的 weekend n. 周末.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... succession 接连发生 successive 连续的 recess 休息；隐居.
英语好的人帮我把以下这一小段中文翻译成英文... ... 历届： the previous year 历届: successive 提名： nominate.
成字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 成功〖 succeed;achievesuccess〗 成功〖 success〗 成规〖 rut;establishedrules〗.
... striker n. 足球（前锋） success n. 成就；成功 successfully adv. 圆满地；顺利地；成功地.

jx.jx_en_mean: following one another at short intervals
following one after the other without interruption

lj.lj_ly: she won the race for the second year in succession.
lj.lj_ls: 她连续赢得了第二年的赛跑冠军。

jx.jx_en_mean: inheriting or elected to the place of
jx.jx_cn_mean: 继承…的（地)，接任…的（地)，当选…的（地）

lj.lj_ly: he was elevated to the Lords in succession to his father.
lj.lj_ls: 他继承父业升为上议院议员。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 决定谁是接替者（或继承人）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting legal transmission of an estate or the throne to another, also in the sense 'successors, heirs'): from Old French, or from Latin successio(n-), from the verb succedere (see succeed).The term in ecology dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: A succession of things of the same kind is a number of them that exist or happen one after the other.

example.ex: Adams took a succession of jobs which have stood him in good stead...
example.tran: 亚当斯连着做过几份让他颇为受益的工作。

example.ex: Scoring three goals in quick succession, he made it 10-8...
example.tran: 在短短的时间内他连进三球，最终以 10 比 8 取胜。

entry.def: Succession is the fact or right of being the next person to have an important job or position.

example.ex: She is now seventh in line of succession to the throne.
example.tran: 她目前是王位的第七顺位继承人。

means.word_mean: 1. a following of one thing after another in time;

sentences.sentence: "the doctor saw a sequence of patients"

means.word_mean: 2. a group of people or things arranged or following in order;

sentences.sentence: "a succession of stalls offering soft drinks"

means.word_mean: 3. the action of following in order;
4. (ecology) the gradual and orderly process of change in an ecosystem brought about by the progressive replacement of one community by another until a stable climax is established
5. acquisition of property by descent or by will

auth_sentence.content: What we're seeing here is not the succession.
auth_sentence.res_content: What we're seeing here is not the succession.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What we're seeing here is not the succession.

auth_sentence.content: We went over all the hot spots in succession.
auth_sentence.res_content: We went over all the hot spots in succession.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We went over all the hot spots in succession.

auth_sentence.content: A thorough wetting under a succession of heavy showers.
auth_sentence.res_content: A thorough wetting under a succession of heavy showers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A thorough wetting under a succession of heavy showers.

stems_affixes.word_buile: access[n.接近;入口 v.存取, 接近]+ible能……的→adj.能接近的;可进去的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
excess[n.过度,过剩]+ive……的→adj.过分的;过度的
in不+accessible[adj.能接近的;可进去的]→adj.难以接近的
suc随后+cess行走,前进+ive……的→随后跟上→连续的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+or人→走在前面的人→祖先
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+ry整体→n.祖先;世系,家世
con共同+cess后退+ion动作或状态→n.让步;退位
ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ary物→n.必需品

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必要性, 需要,必需品
stems_affixes.word_buile: ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ity性质,特性等→n.必要性, 需要,必需品
process[n.过程;进行 v.加工, 处理]+ion表名词→向前走的队伍
re回+cess行走,前进→走回去→休息
re回+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→走回去→撤退
suc随后+cess行走,前进→随后跟上→继续→继续做→成功

stems_affixes.value_cn: 接连发生,继承, 继任
stems_affixes.word_buile: suc随后+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→随后跟上→继续发生→继续别人[事业,成功]→继承, 继任

Sentence.sentence: For the next ten years a succession of books, mainly by Americans, sounded the alarm.

sentences.en: His words came out in quick succession.
sentences.cn: 他的话连珠炮似地说了出来。

sentences.en: The endless succession of parties wore us out.
sentences.cn: 接连不断的聚会把我们累垮了。

means.word_mean: 继承, 继任; 继承权

sentences.en: His succession as headmaster was not in any doubt.
sentences.cn: 他继任校长是确定无疑的。

jushi.english: His succession as headmaster was not in any doubt.
jushi.chinese: 他继任校长是确定无疑的。

jushi.english: His words came out in quick succession.
jushi.chinese: 他的话连珠炮似地说了出来。

jushi.english: The endless succession of parties wore us out.
